channel.title: Azure 4 Everyone
channel.description: Adam Marczak blog created for purpose of personal contribution and sharing knowledge to communities everywhere.

item.description: • Describe User-defined Routes (UDR)

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 21 | Azure Security Groups | Network and Application Security Groups (NSG, ASG)
item.description:
• Describe Network Security Groups (NSG)
  • Describe Application Security Groups (ASG)

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 20 | Azure Advisor
item.description: • Describe Azure Advisor

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 19 | Azure Tools | Azure Portal, CLI, PowerShell & Cloud Shell
item.description: • Describe Azure tools such as Azure Portal, Azure PowerShell, Azure CLI and Cloud Shell

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 18 | Azure DevOps Solutions | Azure DevOps, DevTest Labs
item.description: • Describe DevOps solutions available on Azure such as Azure DevOps and Azure DevTest Labs

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 17 | Azure Serverless Computing Services | Functions, Logic Apps, Event Grid
item.description: • Describe Serverless computing and Azure products that are available for serverless computing such as Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and Event Grid

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 16 | Azure Artificial Intelligence (AI) Services | Machine Learning Studio & Service
item.description: • Describe Artificial Intelligence (AI) and products that are available for AI such as Azure Machine Learning Service and Studio.

item.description:
• Describe Azure Big Data & Analytics Services such as
    • Azure Synapse Analytics
    • Azure HDInsight
    • Azure Databricks

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 14 | Azure IoT Services | IoT Hub, IoT Central, Azure Sphere
item.description:
• Describe Azure IoT Services such as
    • IoT Hub
    • IoT Central
    • Azure Sphere

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 13 | Azure Marketplace
item.description: • Describe Azure Marketplace

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 12 | Database Services | Cosmos DB, SQL Database, Db for MySQL & PostgreSQL
item.description:
• Describe the benefits and usage of
    • Cosmos DB, Azure SQL Database,
    • Azure Database for MySQL,
    • Azure Database for PostgreSQL, and
    • SQL Managed Instance

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 11 | Storage Services | Blob, Queue, Table, Files, Disk Storage and Storage Tiers
item.description:
• Describe products available for Storage such as
    • Blob Storage,
    • Files Storage,
    • Queue Storage,
    • Table Storage,
    • Disk Storage and
    • Storage Tiers

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 10 | Networking Services | Virtual Network, VPN Gateway, CDN, Load Balancer, App GW
item.description:
• Describe products available for Networking such as
    • Virtual Network,
    • Load Balancer,
    • VPN Gateway,
    • Application Gateway and
    • Content Delivery Network

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 9 | Compute Services | Vms, VM Scale Set, App Service, Functions, ACI, AKS
item.description:
• Describe products available for Compute such as
    • Virtual Machines,
    • Virtual Machine Scale Sets,
    • App Services, Functions,
    • Azure Container Instances (ACI) and
    • Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 8 | Resources, Resource Groups & Resource Manager
item.description:
• Describe Resources
  • Describe Resource Groups
  • Describe Resource Manager
  • Describe the benefits and usage of core Azure architectural components

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 7 | Geographies, Regions & Availability Zones | Microsoft Azure Fundamentals Course
item.description:
• Describe Data Centers
  • Describe Regions & Region Pairs
  • Describe Geographies
  • Describe Availability Zones
  • Describe the benefits and usage of core Azure architectural components

item.title: Process Excel files in Azure with Data Factory and Databricks | Tutorial
item.description: Excel files are one of the most commonly used file format on the market. Popularity of the tool itself among the business users, business analysts and data engineers is driven by its flexibility, ease of use, powerful integration features and low price.

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 6 | Public, Private & Hybrid cloud deployment models
item.description:
• Describe Public cloud
  • Describe Private cloud
  • Describe Hybrid cloud
  • Compare and contrast the three different cloud models

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 5 | IaaS vs PaaS vs SaaS cloud service models
item.description:
• Describe Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS)
  • Describe Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS)
  • Describe Software-as-a-Service (SaaS)
  • Compare and contrast the three different service types

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 4 | Consumption-based Model
item.description: • Describe the consumption-based model

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 3 | CapEx vs OpEx and their differences
item.description: • Describe the principles of economies of scale

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 2 | Principle of economies of scale
item.description: • Describe the differences between Capital Expenditure (CapEx) and Operational Expenditure (OpEx)

item.title: AZ-900 Episode 1 | Cloud Computing and Vocabulary
item.description:
• Describe what is Cloud Computing
  • Describe terms such as High Availability, Scalability, Elasticity, Agility, Fault Tolerance, and Disaster Recovery

item.title: AZ-900 | Course Overview
item.description: Azure Fundamentals certification is an opportunity to prove knowledge of cloud concepts, core Azure services, Azure pricing, SLA, and lifecycle, and the fundamentals of cloud security, privacy, compliance, and trust.

My latest tutorial about basics of Azure Active Directory is here. It is a very powerful identity and access management service that is very well integrated with majority of Microsoft’s cloud services.

item.title: Azure Data Factory Custom Email Notifications Tutorial
item.description: Deep-dive episode on implementing end-2-end email notifications in Azure Data Factory. In this episode I will describe out of the box options with Azure Monitor and explain why Logic Apps are better choice.

item.title: Azure Stream Analytics Tutorial | Processing stream data with SQL
item.description: Azure Stream Analytics offer SQL Query language over stream of data, out of the box Azure integrations and custom functions support. Today a quick tutorial around this easy to use streaming service.

item.title: Azure Files Tutorial | Easy file shares in the cloud
item.description: If you want to start using File Shares quickly then Azure has you covered. With Azure Files you can create file shares in the cloud and start using them immediately. Minimum configuration needed. It’s also amazing when extending local on-premises file servers.

item.title: Managed Identities with Azure AD (Active Directory) Tutorial
item.description: Azure AD Managed Identities are one of the best features when it comes to authentication across multiple Azure services. They are secure, managed by Azure AD and incur no additional cost.

item.title: Azure Event Hub Tutorial | Big data message streaming service
item.description: Azure Event Hubs is highly scalable big data event processing service capable of processing millions of events per second.

item.title: Azure Cost Management Tutorial | Analyzing and reacting to changes in billing
item.description: Understanding costs of your Azure resource is one of the most critical items when driving cloud transformation for your organization. In this episode we will take a look at Azure Cost Management.

item.title: Azure Logic Apps Trusted Connectivity to Firewall Protected Blob Storage
item.description: Protecting sensitive data is one of the most critical tasks when it comes to designing cloud applications. But sometimes this imposes challenges when using out of the box components, like in case of logic apps connecting to firewall protected blob storage.

item.title: Azure Data Factory | Copy multiple tables in Bulk with Lookup & ForEach
item.description: With Azure Data Factory Lookup and ForEach activities you can perform dynamic copies of your data tables in bulk within a single pipeline.

item.title: Azure Cloud Shell Tutorial
item.description: Modularization of ARM templates is one of the key concepts for delivering reusable and easy to maintain components for your application infrastructure.

item.title: ARM Templates Modularization
item.description: Modularization of ARM templates is one of the key concepts for delivering reusable and easy to maintain components for your application infrastructure.

item.title: ARM Templates Parameter Files
item.description: With ARM templates you can perform conditional deployment of your Azure infrastructure with ease. All it takes is a simple evaluation.

item.title: ARM Templates Copy Elements
item.description: With Copy Elements you can deploy multiple instances of your resources or properties, all in a single Resource Manager template.

item.title: ARM Templates Orchestration
item.description: If you need to deploy multiple services and combine them together using ARM templates, then this episode is for you. This time we are going to look at orchestration using dependencies and references.

item.title: ARM Templates Parameter Files
item.description: With JSON-based Parameter Files you can supply environment variables consistently and conviniently to your ARM Templates.

item.title: ARM Templates Parametrization
item.description: Expressions, parameters and variables allow anyone to build flexible and reusable ARM templates. They are indeed a powerful tool in hands of skillful developers and administrators.

item.title: ARM Templates Introduction
item.description: Azure Resource Manager Templates provide simple and unified way to create and manage your Azure environments for both developers and administrators. With simple JSON files you can deploy your environment in consistent fashion and at great speed.

item.title: Azure App Configuration Introduction
item.description: Applications running in the cloud have many distributed components. By centralizing application settings and feature flags you can reduce operational costs and complexity of your solutions. Azure App Configuration service delivers all that in simple and clean manner.

item.title: Azure Application Insights Introduction
item.description: Creating logging and performance tracking solution for your applications can be challenging, especially in multi-service cloud environment. In this video I will show you why Azure Application Insights is the right tool for the job.

item.title: Azure Table Storage Introduction
item.description: Do you need simple but scalable NoSQL database in a cloud? Look no further, with Azure Table Storage you can create applications extremely easy while maintaining all the best features of Storage Accounts like geo-replication, security, scalability, high availability and low price. Join me for quick introduction video.

item.title: Azure Queue Storage Introduction
item.description: Azure Queue Storage is simple yet powerful service for storing large number of messages. It is one of core services for implementing scenarios like load-leveling, fan-out, fan-in and those relying on retry capabilities.

item.title: Azure Data Factory Self-hosted Integration Runtime
item.description: With Azure Data Factory Self-hosted integration runtime, you can now integrate your on-premise, virtual private network data sources as well as those which require your own drivers.

item.title: Azure Load Balancer Introduction
item.description: Azure Load balancing allows for distribution of load or incoming network traffic across a group of backend resources or servers. It operates at layer 4 of the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model. It is the single point of contact for clients.

item.title: Azure Traffic Manager Introduction
item.description: Azure Traffic Manager is a DNS-based traffic load balancer that enables you to distribute traffic optimally to services across global Azure regions, while providing high availability and responsiveness.

item.title: Azure Virtual Machine Introduction
item.description: Virtual Machines are beating heart and a core component of any cloud. With wide range of use cases and flexibility of virtualizing most of commonly known operating systems it is possible to move pretty much any software to the cloud.

item.title: Azure Databricks Secret Scopes
item.description: When building solutions in Databricks you need to ensure that all your credentials are securely stored. Today I will show you how to do it using Databricks Secret Scopes and how can you integrate them with Azure Key Vault.

item.title: Azure Data Lake Storage (Gen 2) Introduction
item.description: Data Lake Storage Gen 2 is the best storage solution for big data analytics in Azure. With its Hadoop compatible access, it is a perfect fit for existing platforms like Databricks, Cloudera, Hortonworks, Hadoop, HDInsight and many more. Take advantage of both blob storage and data lake in one service!

item.title: Azure Analysis Services Intro
item.description: With Azure Analysis Services you can scale your Power BI reports up to tens and hundreds of gigabytes of data. It is very fast in-memory database and analytical progressing engine with all the benefits of cloud scaling and security.

item.title: Azure PowerShell Introduction
item.description: Azure PowerShell allows for task automation and operational management of Azure resources at no cost or effort using popular PowerShell scripting language.

item.title: Azure CLI Introduction
item.description: Azure CLI (Command Line Interface) allows developers and operations to complete nearly any scenario for management and automation of Azure resources in no time.

item.title: Azure Automation Introduction
item.description: Azure Automation service is designed specifically to help with day to day operational challenges around process automation, configuration management and update management for both Azure and non-Azure environments. Join me and see what is this service all about.

item.title: Azure Azure Data Factory Mapping Data Flow
item.description: With Azure Data Factory Mapping Data Flow, you can create fast and scalable on-demand transformations by using visual user interface. In just minutes you can leverage power of Spark with not a single line of code written.

item.title: Azure SQL Database Intro
item.description: Azure SQL Database is one of the key data storage solution for structured data in Azure. If you need to manage structured data via schema, constraints and relationships or you need to explore your data via rich query language then this might be the right service for you.

item.title: Azure Bot Service Intro
item.description: Azure Bot Service and Bot Framework provide tools to build, test, deploy, and manage intelligent bots all in one place.

item.title: Azure Key Vault Intro
item.description: Using Azure Key Vault Service allows for centralization and protection of your application secrets, certificates but also encryption keys for Virtual Machines..

item.title: Azure Data Factory Triggers
item.description: Choosing the right trigger type is very important task when designing data factory workflows. Today I will show you four ways to trigger data factory pipelines so you can make sure you react to your business needs better.

item.title: Azure Event Grid Intro
item.description: Azure Event Grid is fast and reliable event routing service allowing developers to create real time applications and decouple their systems at ease. Thanks to event grid built in events you can quickly automate Azure subscription for all your operation needs.

item.title: Continuous Deployment using App Service Deployment Center
item.description: Continuous Deployment is great way to increase productivity for developers in any technology out there. With Azure App Service deployment center, you can quickly set up continuous deployment for your web apps and serverless functions without need to learn complicated external tools and platforms, all this in just few minutes.

item.title: Azure Container Instances Intro
item.description: If you are looking for a quick way to host your containers in Azure, then look no further. With Azure Container Instances you can host your containers in minutes without need to run complicated provisioning or infrastructure management. A true container service for beginners.

item.title: Azure Logic Apps Conditions, Loops, Parallel Executions and more using Control Actions
item.description: Using conditions, loops and parallel execution allows developers to implement much more complex Enterprise Integration scenarios using Azure Logic Apps. All those actions are available through Control Actions group which we will learn all about Today.

item.title: Azure Cosmos DB Intro
item.description: Azure Cosmos DB is globally distributed and highly responsive database in the cloud. With just few clicks you can get multi-regional distribution and redundancy with high availability of 99.999%.

item.title: Azure Data Factory Parametrization
item.description: Parametrization in Azure Data Factory is essential to achieve good design and reusability as well as low cost of solution maintenance. Using parameters also speeds up implementation of new features in your pipelines.

item.title: Azure Databricks Intro
item.description: Azure Databricks is fast, easy to use and scalable big data collaboration platform. Based on Apache Spark brings high performance and benefits of spark without need of having high technical knowledge. You just write Python/Scala scripts and you are ready to go.

item.title: Azure Function Apps Intro
item.description: Serverless is powerful and flexible way of delivering fast and scalable solutions in Azure. Today we will get introduction about Azure Function Apps, one of my favorite services and one of the best serverless services out there.

item.title: Azure Storage Intro
item.description: Choosing the right storage solution is critical part of every application design. Azure Storage is one of the most flexible and powerful, yet simple services in Azure. With its four services (file, blob, queue and table) it can feed most of common needs.

item.title: Azure App Service Introduction
item.description: Web development is the beating heart of cloud applications. Azure App Service is one of key compute services which streamlines development and maintenance of web applications. It is powerful Platform as a Service offering with many of security and DevOps features.

item.title: Azure Data Factory Introduction
item.description: Azure Data Factory is essential service in all data related activities in Azure. It is flexible and powerful Platform as a Service offering with multitude of connectors and inetgration capabilities. It is a heart of ETL in Azure.

item.title: Azure Logic Apps Introduction
item.description: Azure Logic Apps are Enterprise Integration Service and as such their main purpose is orchestration, integration and scheduling of tasks in a simple way. With easy to use user interface, no coding design and powerful extensibility you can easily integrate services in minutes.
